intro: Hypochaeris meyeniana var. brachylepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved common groundsel, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow composite flowers with ray florets. The plant is native to South America and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It has a short stature, typically growing to a height of 10–30 cm. The species is known for its ability to spread vegetatively through its rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in agricultural and natural areas.
